de.fraunhofer.iem.secucheck.InternalFluentTQL.catalog.PathTraversalAttack.CWE22

Class PathTraversal

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • de.fraunhofer.iem.secucheck.InternalFluentTQL.catalog.PathTraversalAttack.CWE22.PathTraversal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class PathTraversal
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    This class contains the example of Path traversal attack. This example has been taken from the OWASP Benchmark: BenchmarkTest00001 and modified slightly.
    See Also:
    BenchmarkTest00001, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PathTraversal() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doGetWithoutSanitizer(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      This method returns the content of the file with the filename given by the user, this method does not use sanitizer, therefore this method contains path traversal attack.
      void doGetWithSanitizer(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      This method returns the content of the file with the filename given by the user, This method uses sanitizer, therefore this method avoids path traversal attack.
      java.lang.String sanitizeForPATH(java.lang.String fileName)
      This method sanitizes the file name with the black list technique.

      • PathTraversal

        public PathTraversal()

    • Method Detail

      • doGetWithoutSanitizer

        public void doGetWithoutSanitizer(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        This method returns the content of the file with the filename given by the user, this method does not use sanitizer, therefore this method contains path traversal attack.
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServlet request from the user.
        response - HttpServlet response to the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If fails to load the file.

      • doGetWithSanitizer

        public void doGetWithSanitizer(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method returns the content of the file with the filename given by the user, This method uses sanitizer, therefore this method avoids path traversal attack. This method uses a simple user defined sanitizer. There are different ways to avoid path traversal, this method is not recommended to avoid the path traversal.
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServlet request from the user.
        response - HttpServlet response to the user.

      • sanitizeForPATH

        public java.lang.String sanitizeForPATH(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method sanitizes the file name with the black list technique. It encoded ../ ..\ ./ .\ This method is not recommended to avoid path traversal attack, this is used as a example here.
        Parameters:
        fileName - File name.
        Returns:
        sanitized file name.
